010package imagingbook.common.edges;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013import static java.lang.Math.atan2;
014import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
015
016import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
017import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * Simple grayscale edge detector for all types of images. Color images are converted to grayscale before edge
026 * detection. See Sec. 5.3 of [1] for a detailed description.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
030 * (2022).
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2022/12/12
035 * @see GrayscaleEdgeDetector
036 */
037public class GrayscaleEdgeDetector implements EdgeDetector {
038
039        private final int M;    // image width
040        private final int N;    // image height
041        private final FloatProcessor Emag;      // edge magnitude map
042        private final FloatProcessor Eort;      // edge orientation map
043        
044        // Sobel-kernels for x/y-derivatives:
045    private static final float[][] HxS = Matrix.multiply(1.0f/8, new float[][] {
046                        {-1, 0, 1},
047                    {-2, 0, 2},
048                    {-1, 0, 1}});
049
050    private static final float[][] HyS = Matrix.multiply(1.0f/8, new float[][] {
051                        {-1, -2, -1},
052                        { 0,  0,  0},
053                        { 1,  2,  1}});
054
055        public GrayscaleEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip) {
056                this.M = ip.getWidth();
057                this.N = ip.getHeight();
058                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
059                Eort = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
060                findEdges(ip);
061        }
062
063        private void findEdges(ImageProcessor ip) {
064                FloatProcessor I = (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) ?
065                                IjUtils.toFloatProcessor((ColorProcessor) ip) :
066                                ip.convertToFloatProcessor();
067                
068            FloatProcessor Ix = I;
069            FloatProcessor Iy = (FloatProcessor) Ix.duplicate();
070
071                IjUtils.convolve(Ix, HxS);
072                IjUtils.convolve(Iy, HyS);
073                
074                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
075                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
076                                // extract the gradients of the R, G, B channels:
077                                double dx = Ix.getf(u, v);      
078                                double dy = Iy.getf(u, v);
079                                // calculate local edge magnitude:
080                                Emag.setf(u, v, (float) sqrt(sqr(dx) + sqr(dy)));
081                                // calculate edge orientation for the maximum channel:
082                                Eort.setf(u, v, (float) atan2(dy, dx));
083                        }
084                }
085        }
086        
087        @Override
088        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
089                return Emag;
090        }
091
092        @Override
093        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
094                return Eort;
095        }
096        
097}
